body.p: “The snow still adheres conspicuously to the north-west sides of the stems of the trees quite up to their summits “,” with a remarkably sharp edge in that direction “,” –in a horizontal section like this: [drawing] It would be about as good as a compass to steer by in a cloudy day or by night.”
PE 9, pg. 124-125 / 3 Sept, 1854 – 12 May, 1855 / NNPM MA 1302:24 / T vol. # XVIII / PDF # XIII
